notes: Laws One and Two: ‘When a distinguished but elderly scientist states that something is possible, he is almost certainly right. When he states that something is impossible, he is very probably wrong’; and ‘The only way of discovering the limits of the possible is to venture a little way past them into the impossible.’

We also highly recommend Bone Sharps, Cowboys, and Thunder Lizards: A Tale of Edward Drinker Cope, Othniel Charles Marsh, and the Gilded Age of Paleontology (G. T. Labs, 2005). Sub-supernote comic book geek-out: Ottaviani’s publishing company, G. T. Labs, is named after the lab where a spider bit Peter Parker.

Inspired by Jim Steinmayer’s Hiding the Elephant: How Magicians Invented the Impossible and Learned to Disappear, Levitation is largely drawn from an exceedingly rare tell-all named Magic and Stagecraft, written by Guy Jarrett, one of Thurston’s inventors.
